    • Method Detail

      • mount

        public Boolean mount(String[] options)
        This is a short method for adding additional options to a mount location or device. For an example, parsing remount instructions.
        Parameters:
        options - A string array containing all of the mount options to parse
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise
        See Also:
        mount(String, String, String[])

      • mount

        public Boolean mount(String location)
        This is a short method for attaching a device or folder to a location, without any options or file system type specifics.
        Parameters:
        location - The location where the device or folder should be attached to
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise
        See Also:
        mount(String, String, String[])

      • mount

        public Boolean mount(String location,
                     String[] options)
        This is a short method for attaching a device or folder to a location, without any file system type specifics.
        Parameters:
        location - The location where the device or folder should be attached to
        options - A string array containing all of the mount options to parse
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise
        See Also:
        mount(String, String, String[])

      • mount

        public Boolean mount(String location,
                     String type)
        This is a short method for attaching a device or folder to a location, without any options.
        Parameters:
        location - The location where the device or folder should be attached to
        type - The file system type to mount a device as
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise
        See Also:
        mount(String, String, String[])

      • mount

        public Boolean mount(String location,
                     String type,
                     String[] options)
        This is used for attaching a device or folder to a location, or to change any mount options on a current mounted file system.
        Note that if the device parsed to the constructor #Disk(Shell, String) is a folder, this method will use the --bind option to attach it to the location. Also note that when attaching folders to a location, the type and options arguments will not be used and should just be parsed as NULL.
        Parameters:
        location - The location where the device or folder should be attached to
        type - The file system type to mount a device as
        options - A string array containing all of the mount options to parse
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise

      • unmount

        public Boolean unmount()
        This method is used to remove an attachment of a device or folder (unmount).
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise

      • move

        public Boolean move(String destination)
        This method is used to move a mount location to another location.
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise

      • isMounted

        public Boolean isMounted()
        This is used to check whether the current device or folder is attached to a location (Mounted).
        Returns:
        True if mounted, False otherwise

      • hasOption

        public Boolean hasOption(String option)
        This is used to check if a mounted file system was mounted with a specific mount option. Note that options like mode=xxxx can also be checked by just parsing mode as the argument.
        Parameters:
        option - The name of the option to find
        Returns:
        True if the options was used to attach the device, False otherwise

      • getOption

        public String getOption(String option)
        This can be used to get the value of a specific mount option that was used to attach the file system. Note that options like noexec, nosuid and nodev does not have any values and will return NULL. This method is used to get values from options like gid=xxxx, mode=xxxx and size=xxxx where xxxx is the value.
        Parameters:
        option - The name of the option to find
        Returns:
        True if the options was used to attach the device, False otherwise

      • getMountDetails

        public Filesystem.MountStat getMountDetails()
        This is the same as Filesystem.getMountList(), only this method will just return the mount information for this specific device or mount location.
        Returns:
        A single Filesystem.MountStat object

      • getFsDetails

        public Filesystem.MountStat getFsDetails()
        This is the same as Filesystem.getFsList(), only this method will just return the mount information for this specific device or mount location.
        Returns:
        A single Filesystem.MountStat object

      • getDiskDetails

        public Filesystem.DiskStat getDiskDetails()
        Like with Filesystem.getMountList(), this will also return information like device path and mount location. However, it will not return information like file system type or mount options, but instead information about the disk size, remaining bytes, used bytes and usage percentage.
        Returns:
        A single Filesystem.DiskStat object
